cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 560 mi SE of Galveston Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest then north-northwest toward the Upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX/LA border (Cameron-Sabine Pass area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch east of Intracoastal City to west of Morgan City LA; Storm-Surge Watch Freeport TX to San Luis Pass TX and mouth of Mississippi River to Ocean Springs MS
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning San Luis Pass TX to Intracoastal City LA; Storm-Surge Warning San Luis Pass TX to Mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast (including Galveston Bay) and southwest Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) likely late Wednesday with a 21–28 % chance of hurricane-force (≥74 mph) gusts during the passage; sustained 50-kt wind probability peaks near 31 %.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation in Galveston Bay and along the island of 3–5 ft above ground level; higher 6–9 ft just east toward Port Bolivar/Sea Rim State Park.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated totals to 12 inches possible, producing flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornadoes in rainbands Wednesday night–Thursday.
